DataElement.preferredName: Serological Laboratory Procedure Toxoplasmosis Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date on which the toxoplasma serology laboratory test was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A parasitic disease contracted by the ingestion or fetal transmission of toxoplasma gondii._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A parasitic disease contracted by the ingestion or fetal transmission of toxoplasma gondii.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A parasitic disease contracted by the ingestion or fetal transmission of toxoplasma gondii.
Executed and carried through to completion.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.

DataElement.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON
